unnormalised: I'm applying for a new job and they're asking for a lot of IDs. Can anyone clarify which ones are absolutely essential vs. just good to have?
normalised: I am applying for a new job and they are asking for a lot of I-Ds. Can anyone clarify which ones are absolutely essential versus just good to have?

unnormalised: Generally speaking, when applying for jobs in India, you'll always need your PAN card. It's crucial for tax purposes; the recruiting company will require your PAN number, e.g., ABCDE1234F, to comply with income tax regulations. They might also ask for your Aadhaar card (e.g., 1234 5678 9012), which is often used for KYC (Know Your Customer) verification and address proof. While not always mandatory, it streamlines the onboarding process.
normalised: Generally speaking, when applying for jobs in India, you will always need your P-A-N card. It is crucial for tax purposes; the recruiting company will require your P-A-N number, e.g., A-B-C-D-E one two three four F, to comply with income tax regulations. They might also ask for your Aadhaar card, e.g., one two three four five six seven eight nine zero one two, which is often used for K-Y-C Know Your Customer verification and address proof. While not always mandatory, it streamlines the onboarding process.

unnormalised: Beyond these, your previous employment details are essential. This often involves providing your Employee Provident Fund (EPF) account number (e.g., MH/PUN/1234567/12345), if applicable, to facilitate the transfer of your PF balance. They might also ask for your UAN (Universal Account Number), a 12-digit number linked to your EPF. For educational qualifications, ensure you have your degree certificates and mark sheets readily available, especially the roll numbers like "Roll No. 12345" or "Regd. No. 67890" for verification.
normalised: Beyond these, your previous employment details are essential. This often involves providing your Employee Provident Fund E-P-F account number, e.g., M-H slash P-U-N slash one two three four five six seven slash one two three four five, if applicable, to facilitate the transfer of your P-F balance. They might also ask for your U-A-N Universal Account Number, a twelve digit number linked to your E-P-F. For educational qualifications, ensure you have your degree certificates and mark sheets readily available, especially the roll numbers like "Roll No. one two three four five" or "Regd. No. six seven eight nine zero" for verification.

unnormalised: Finally, a few other IDs can be helpful. A Voter ID (e.g., ABC1234567) can serve as address proof, though Aadhaar is typically preferred. If you have a professional license (e.g., Medical Council Registration number – say, 12345), definitely include it if it's relevant to the job. Keeping these documents handy will definitely prepone the joining formalities.
